listeningQuestion.question: Why were reports of a wild puma not taken seriously at first?
listeningQuestion.translation: 为什么关于野生美洲狮的报告最初没有被当真？

content.editorNotes: 本课是新概念英语第三册的第一课，通过一个在伦敦郊外发现美洲狮的故事，介绍了一系列重要词汇和表达方式。文章描述了人们如何逐渐确认这确实是一只美洲狮的过程。

dialogueText.heading: 课文
dialogue: When reports came into London Zoo that a wild puma had been spotted forty-five miles south of London, they were not taken seriously. However, as the evidence began to accumulate, experts from the Zoo felt obliged to investigate, for the descriptions given by people who claimed to have seen the puma were extraordinarily similar.

The hunt for the puma began in a small village where a woman picking blackberries saw 'a large cat' only five yards away from her. It immediately ran away when she saw it, and experts confirmed that a puma will not attack a human being unless it is cornered.

The search proved difficult, for the puma was often observed at one place in the morning and at another place twenty miles away in the evening. Wherever it went, it left behind it a trail of dead deer and small animals like rabbits. Paw prints were seen in a number of places and puma fur was found clinging to bushes.

Several people complained of 'cat-like noises' at night and a businessman on a fishing trip saw the puma up a tree. The experts were now fully convinced that the animal was a puma, but where had it come from? As no pumas had been reported missing from any zoo in the country, this one must have been in the possession of a private collector and somehow managed to escape. The hunt for the puma continued for several weeks, but the puma was not caught.
It is disturbing to think that a dangerous wild animal is still at large in the quiet countryside.

translation.heading: 翻译
notes: 当伦敦动物园接到报告说，在伦敦以南45英里处发现了一只野生美洲狮时，这些报告并没有被当真。然而，随着证据的逐渐积累，动物园的专家们感到有必要进行调查，因为声称看到美洲狮的人们所描述的特征非常相似。
对美洲狮的搜寻从一个小村庄开始，那里一位正在采摘黑莓的妇女看到'一只大猫'，离她只有5码远。当她看到它时，它立即逃走了，专家们证实，美洲狮除非被逼到绝境，否则不会攻击人类。
搜寻工作很困难，因为常常是早晨在一个地方看到这只美洲狮，晚上却在20英里外的另一个地方发现它。无论它走到哪里，都会留下一串死鹿和兔子之类的小动物。在许多地方都发现了爪印，灌木丛中发现了粘在上面的美洲狮毛。
几个人抱怨夜里听到'像猫一样的叫声'，一位去钓鱼的商人看见那只美洲狮在树上。专家们现在完全确信那动物就是美洲狮，但它是从哪里来的呢？由于全国动物园没有关于美洲狮丢失的报告，这只美洲狮一定是私人收藏的，不知怎么设法逃脱了。对美洲狮的搜寻持续了几个星期，但始终未能捉到它。
想到在宁静的乡村里仍有一头危险的野兽在逍遥法外，真令人担忧。

notes.extended: v. 使走投无路，使陷入困境
adv. 不知怎么搞地，不知什么原因

phrase.heading: 短语使用 Phrase in use

notesOnText.heading: 课文详注 Further notes on the text

notes.title: extraordinarily similar
notes.content: 非常相似。extraordinarily是副词，强调相似度之高。表达相似可以使用particularly alike, had a lot in common等。

notes.title: Pumas are large, cat-like animals
notes.content: 大型猫科动物。cat-like是形容词，表示'像猫的'。类似构成的形容词还有：bear-like(像熊的), lady-like(淑女般的), child-like(孩子般的)等。

notes.title: be found in
notes.content: 产于。表示某种动植物分布在某个地区。例如：Many plant and animal species are found only in the rainforests.

notes.title: a trail of dead deer and small animals
notes.content: 一连串死去的鹿和小动物。trail表示一系列的痕迹或踪迹。类似表达：a trail of unpaid bills(一连串未付的账单), a trail of broken hearts(一连串伤心的人)。

notes.title: 关系代词省略
notes.content: 当关系代词作主语，其后紧接be动词时，关系词和be动词可同时省略。例如：a puma which was at large可以省略为a puma at large。

notes.title: had been seen
notes.content: 过去完成时被动语态，表示在过去某一时间点之前已经被看到。

notes.title: must have done
notes.content: 对过去的肯定推测。例如：'this one must have been in the possession of a private collector'表示推测这只美洲狮一定是私人收藏的。

notes.title: 方位介词
notes.content: 文中使用了'forty-five miles south of London'，其中方位词前的介词to可以省略。方位介词包括：in/on/to the south of，只有to可省略。

examples.en: It is disturbing to think that a dangerous wild animal is still at large.
examples.cn: 想到在宁静的乡村里仍有一头危险的野兽在逍遥法外，真令人担忧。

examples.en: It is worrying to think that we might fail the exam.
examples.cn: 想到我们可能会考试失败，真令人担忧。

examples.en: It is exciting to think that we will graduate next month.
examples.cn: 想到我们下个月就要毕业了，真令人兴奋。

notes.pattern: Wherever it went, it left behind it a trail of ...

examples.en: Wherever he went, he left a trail of unpaid bills behind him.
examples.cn: 无论他去哪里，都会留下一串未付的账单。

examples.en: Wherever he went, he left a trail of broken hearts behind him.
examples.cn: 无论他去哪里，都会留下一串伤心的人。

notes.title: 写作练习
notes.content: 课后要求学生扩写一段关于Mrs. Stone看到美洲狮的经历的段落，从'Mrs. Stone had spent the whole morning...'开始，扩展到约150个词。

notes.title: 同位语从句和定语从句的区别
notes.content: 从定义上看：同位语从句解释前面名词的具体内容；而定语从句仅起到后置定语的作用，常译为'……的'。从形式上看：同位语从句中的'that'仅起到连接符号的作用，不充当语法成分；而定语从句中的'that'是关系代词，在从句中充当主语、宾语或表语。
